text: This is a list of the heads of state of Grenada, from the independence of Grenada in 1974 to the present day. From 1974 the head of state under the Grenada Independence Act 1974 is the Queen of Grenada, Elizabeth II, who is also the monarch in each of the other Commonwealth realms. The Queen is represented in Grenada by a Governor-General. ==Monarch (1974–present)== The succession to the throne is the same as the succession to the British throne. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !rowspan=2|№ !rowspan=2|Monarch !rowspan=2|Portrait !colspan=3|Reign !rowspan=2|Royal House !rowspan=2|Prime Minister |- !Reign start !Reign end !Duration |- ! 1 | Queen Elizabeth II | 60px | 1974 | | | Windsor | Gairy Bishop Coard Austin Brathwaite Blaize Jones Brathwaite Brizan Mitchell Thomas Mitchell |} ===Governor-General=== The Governor-General is the representative of the Monarch in Grenada and exercises most of the powers of the Monarch. The Governor-General is appointed for an indefinite term, serving at the pleasure of the Monarch. After the passage of the Statute of Westminster 1931, the Governor-General is appointed solely on the advice of the Cabinet of Grenada without the involvement of the British government.
